p: From a T matrix (traits x grid coordinates; using SYNCSA R package, function “matrix.t”–[ 68], we performed the Indicator Value Analysis, which varies from 0 to 1 (IndVal; [ 69]), using carbon emission scenarios as a factor with five different levels). IndVal identifies which traits are significantly increased or decreased in frequency in future scenarios. Good indicator traits would be those that are both abundant in a specific scenario (specificity) and predominantly found in a scenario (fidelity). Because we only used presence and absence, we only used fidelity. The statistical significance level adopted was α = 0.05, and these analyses were performed in R environment, using the package labdsv, function “indval” [ 65].
